did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Contains published material and a small amount of miscellany about the American poet and musician. Some letters by Lanier himself.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Sidney Lanier (1842-1881) was an American poet and musician. He was a soldier in the Confederate army, a lawyer and a teacher before beginning to write poetry, and eventually joined the faculty at Johns Hopkins University where he lectured on the English novelists and Elizabethan and Anglo-Saxon poets. He took up the flute in the late 1870s or early 1880s, and for a time played with the Peabody Orchestra in Baltimore, Maryland. He was known for combining music and poetry in a proselike form known as logaoedic verse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Sidney Lanier Collection consists of correspondence, published material, and a small amount of miscellany. Included are several copies of a musical piece entitled "The Grasshopper: A Tragic Cantata." The connection of this piece to Lanier is unknown, as he is not listed as either the composer or the lyricist. The collection was likely accumulated by John S. Mayfield.
Correspondence contains outgoing letters from Lanier.
Published material consists of items about Lanier (nothing by him).
Miscellaneous consists of items about the American poet and musician, including correspondence between John S. Mayfield and others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Correspondence is in chronological order. Published material is alphabetical by type of material. Miscellaneous correspondence is arranged chronologically and the printing plates are in no particular order.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has a number of published works by and about Sidney Lanier in both our regular and Rare Books holdings. Please search &summitref; for these related materials.
